title: Pawns Are The Soul of Chess || Ju Wenjun vs Goryachkina || Women's World Championship GAME 4
description:
Follow me on Instagram for extra content https://www.instagram.com/agadmator/

Ju Wenjun vs Aleksandra Goryachkina
Ju - Goryachkina Women's World Championship (2020), Shanghai CHN, rd 4, Jan-09
Slav Defense: Soultanbeieff Variation (D16)

1. d4 d5 2. c4 c6 3. Nf3 Nf6 4. Nc3 dc4 5. a4 e6 6. e3 c5 7. Bc4 cd4 8. ed4 Nc6 9. O-O Be7 10. d5 ed5 11. Nd5 Nd5 12. Bd5 O-O 13. Be3 Bf5 14. Qb3 Nb4 15. Rfd1 Qa5 16. Ne5 Nd5 17. Rd5 Qa6 18. Nd7 Be6 19. Nf8 Kf8 20. Qb5 Bd5 21. Qd5 Rd8 22. Qe4 h6 23. g3 b6 24. Rc1 f6 25. Kg2 Rc8 26. Rc8 Qc8 27. Qd5 Ke8 28. h4 Qd7 29. Qg8 Bf8 30. Qc4 h5 31. Kh2 Be7 32. b3 Kf8 33. Qc2 Bd6 34. Qe4 Bc5 35. Bc5 bc5 36. a5 Qe7 37. Qa8 Kf7 38. a6 g6 39. Qd5 Kg7 40. Qb7 Kf8 41. Kg2 Ke8 42. Qa8 Kf7 43. Qd5 Kg7 44. Kf3 Kf8 45. Qb7 Ke8 46. Qd5 Kf8 47. Kf4 Qc7 48. Ke3 Qc8 49. Qb7 Qd8 50. Kf3 Qe7 51. Qe7 Ke7 52. g4 Kd6 53. gh5 gh5 54. Ke4 Kc6 55. f4 Kb5 56. Kd5 f5 57. Kd6 Kb6 58. Kd7 Ka5 59. Kc7 Ka6 60. Kc6 Ka5 61. Kc5 Ka6 62. b4 Kb7 63. Kd5

The 2020 FIDE Women's World Chess Championship is a 12-game match between Chinese reigning champion Ju Wenjun and Russian challenger Aleksandra Goryachkina, who won the 2019 FIDE Women's Candidates Tournament. The first six games will be played in Shanghai, China and the remaining games in Vladivostok, Russia.

The prize fund is 500,000 euros, split 60:40, or 55:45 in case of a playoff. The players receive 90 minutes for the first 40 moves followed by 30 minutes for the rest of the game, with a 30-second increment from move one. No draw offers are allowed before move 40. In case of a 6:6 tie four 25+10 rapid games will be played followed, if necessary, by up to 5 pairs of 5+3 blitz games and, finally, Armageddon. Official website: wwcm2020.fide.com
